messages.title: A personal message from Simon Wilson
messages.content: Since 2010 Conservative policies have resulted in a stronger economic recovery with 12000 more jobs and reducing North East constituents' income tax.

messages.title: Making our roads safer
messages.content: The Conservative-led government recently granted Leeds City Council £4.5 million to repair roads, ensuring safer and less congested travel.

messages.title: Better Schools Mean Better Futures
messages.content: Conservatives' £84 million investment into schools in Leeds will support children to maximize their potential.

messages.title: Delivering More Jobs & Opportunities
messages.content: Under the Conservative economy, 1047 jobs have been created, with increasing wages and 2300 apprenticeships since 2010 in Leeds North East.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support local businesses to invest locally, boost the economy and create more jobs.
Work with local schools so that they can help every pupil reach their full potential.
Ensure additional government money is wisely spent to repair potholes and make road improvements.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Coalition of chaos, Vince Cable: Lib Dems could enter rainbow coalition with Labour and SNP, Voting for UKIP will hand keys of No. 10 to Miliband, poll finds

issues.economy: Discussing Conservative-led recovery, stronger economy, more jobs, and lower taxes.
issues.education: Conservative investment into schools to help students reach their potential.

housing.content: Conservative policies will mean less of this hassle.

leaflet.personalStatement: I will be a strong voice, fighting for Leeds North East.

politicalExperience.achievements: Highlighted the importance of a great education for our children.

contactInformation.address: Please see the official campaign longer form address.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet features information on Conservative policies' past successes and future promises for local improvement and economic development.
